trans-unit.source: A browser layer for which this CORS policy is registered. Useful for overriding existing policies or for making them available only if a specific add-on has been installed.
trans-unit.target: A browser layer for which this CORS policy is registered. Useful for overriding existing policies or for making them available only if a specific add-on has been installed.

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of HTTP method names that are allowed by this CORS policy, e.g. “DELETE,GET,OPTIONS,PATCH,POST,PUT”. If not specified, all methods for which there’s a service registerd are allowed.
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of HTTP method names that are allowed by this CORS policy, e.g. “DELETE,GET,OPTIONS,PATCH,POST,PUT”. If not specified, all methods for which there’s a service registerd are allowed.

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of request headers allowed to be sent by the client, e.g. “X-My-Header”
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of request headers allowed to be sent by the client, e.g. “X-My-Header”

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of response headers clients can access, e.g. “Content-Length,X-My-Header”.
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of response headers clients can access, e.g. “Content-Length,X-My-Header”.

trans-unit.source: Add Plone 4.3, 5.0 and 5.1 to list classifiers in setup.py. [timo]
trans-unit.target: Add Plone 4.3, 5.0 and 5.1 to list classifiers in setup.py. [timo]

trans-unit.source: Add regression tests for service dispatching. [lgraf]
trans-unit.target: Add regression tests for service dispatching. [lgraf]

trans-unit.source: Add support for browser layers. REST services can now be registered to a specific browser layer using the ‘layer’ attribute. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Add support for browser layers. REST services can now be registered to a specific browser layer using the ‘layer’ attribute. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Add support for content negotiation. REST services are no longer hardwired to ‘application/json’ Accept headers. Instead the media type can be configured with the service directive. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Add support for content negotiation. REST services are no longer hardwired to ‘application/json’ Accept headers. Instead the media type can be configured with the service directive. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Add support for named services which allows registering services like
trans-unit.target: Add support for named services which allows registering services like

trans-unit.source: Add support for redirects from plone.app.redirector. [lgraf]
trans-unit.target: Add support for redirects from plone.app.redirector. [lgraf]

trans-unit.source: Allow virtual hosting scenarios. This fixes #48. [tomgross]
trans-unit.target: Allow virtual hosting scenarios. This fixes #48. [tomgross]

trans-unit.source: Any other request method than GET (
trans-unit.target: Any other request method than GET (

trans-unit.source: CORS policies can be bound to specific interfaces of content objects and to specific browser layers. This allows us to define different policies for different content types or to override existing policies. The following example defines a policy for the site root.
trans-unit.target: CORS policies can be bound to specific interfaces of content objects and to specific browser layers. This allows us to define different policies for different content types or to override existing policies. The following example defines a policy for the site root.

trans-unit.source: CORS preflight should happen for all error codes, fixes #101 [sneridagh] (#101)
trans-unit.target: CORS preflight should happen for all error codes, fixes #101 [sneridagh] (#101)

trans-unit.source: Content negotiation: Services can be registered for arbitrary media types (e.g. ‘application/json’).
trans-unit.target: Content negotiation: Services can be registered for arbitrary media types (e.g. ‘application/json’).

trans-unit.source: Do not handle view namespace at all. This fixes: https://github.com/plone/plone.rest/issues/50 [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Do not handle view namespace at all. This fixes: https://github.com/plone/plone.rest/issues/50 [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Do not render service in preflight requests when no CORS policy was defined. Fixes: https://github.com/plone/plone.rest/issues/63 [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Do not render service in preflight requests when no CORS policy was defined. Fixes: https://github.com/plone/plone.rest/issues/63 [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Fallback to regular views during traversal to ensure compatibility with views beeing called with a specific Accept header. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Fallback to regular views during traversal to ensure compatibility with views beeing called with a specific Accept header. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Get rid of Products.Five.metaclass dependency for Zope 4 compatibility. [timo]
trans-unit.target: Get rid of Products.Five.metaclass dependency for Zope 4 compatibility. [timo]

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a ready-made full RESTful Plone API, you should use plone.restapi. That package uses, and depends upon, this one.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a ready-made full RESTful Plone API, you should use plone.restapi. That package uses, and depends upon, this one.

trans-unit.source: Implement permission handling. The permission required to access a service must be declared in the service directive. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Implement permission handling. The permission required to access a service must be declared in the service directive. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Improve message for 404 Not Found exceptions (don’t return HTML). [lgraf]
trans-unit.target: Improve message for 404 Not Found exceptions (don’t return HTML). [lgraf]

trans-unit.source: Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the resource supports user credentials in the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the resource supports user credentials in the request.

trans-unit.target: Named services can be registered by providing a ‘name’ attribute in the service directive:

trans-unit.source: Origins that are allowed to access the resource. Either a comma separated list of origins, e.g. “http://example.net,http://mydomain.com” or “*”.
trans-unit.target: Origins that are allowed to access the resource. Either a comma separated list of origins, e.g. “http://example.net,http://mydomain.com” or “*”.

trans-unit.source: REST stands for Representational State Transfer. It is a software architectural principle to create loosely coupled web APIs.
trans-unit.target: REST stands for Representational State Transfer. It is a software architectural principle to create loosely coupled web APIs.

trans-unit.source: Refactor Dexterity tests to make sure services return the correct object. [timo]
trans-unit.target: Refactor Dexterity tests to make sure services return the correct object. [timo]

trans-unit.source: Refactor traversal of REST requests by using a traversal adapter on the site root instead of a traversal adapter for each REST service. This prevents REST services from being overriden by other traversal adapters. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Refactor traversal of REST requests by using a traversal adapter on the site root instead of a traversal adapter for each REST service. This prevents REST services from being overriden by other traversal adapters. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Register services with the Zope configuration system. This provides better conflict detection and resolution. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Register services with the Zope configuration system. This provides better conflict detection and resolution. [buchi]

trans-unit.target: Registering RESTful service endpoints for the following HTTP verbs:

trans-unit.source: Release fix. 1.0a2 was a brown-bag release. This fixes https://github.com/plone/plone.rest/issues/34. [timo]
trans-unit.target: Release fix. 1.0a2 was a brown-bag release. This fixes https://github.com/plone/plone.rest/issues/34. [timo]

trans-unit.source: Remove “layer” from service directive for now, because it is not yet implemented properly. [jone]
trans-unit.target: Remove “layer” from service directive for now, because it is not yet implemented properly. [jone]

trans-unit.source: Remove CMFPlone and make plone.app.redirector dependency optional [timo] (#81)
trans-unit.target: Remove CMFPlone and make plone.app.redirector dependency optional [timo] (#81)

trans-unit.source: Remove JSON render implementation in service base class. Services must provide their own render implementation. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Remove JSON render implementation in service base class. Services must provide their own render implementation. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Remove request method specific marker interfaces (IGET, IPOST, etc.) because they’re no longer required for service lookup. [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Remove request method specific marker interfaces (IGET, IPOST, etc.) because they’re no longer required for service lookup. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: Remove unnecessary dependency on Products.CMFPlone. Import ISiteRoot from Products.CMFCore.interfaces instead of IPloneSiteRoot from Products.CMFPlone.interfaces.siteroot. [jordic]
trans-unit.target: Remove unnecessary dependency on Products.CMFPlone. Import ISiteRoot from Products.CMFCore.interfaces instead of IPloneSiteRoot from Products.CMFPlone.interfaces.siteroot. [jordic]

trans-unit.source: Restrict traversal of REST requests to content objects. This allows us to override existing views with a named service (e.g. /search). [buchi]
trans-unit.target: Restrict traversal of REST requests to content objects. This allows us to override existing views with a named service (e.g. /search). [buchi]

trans-unit.target: Set development status to production/stable in setup.py. [timo]

trans-unit.target: Simplify patch of DynamicType pre-traversal hook and actually make it work with Archetypes. [buchi]

trans-unit.source: The reason for separating this infrastructure into a separate package from the ‘main’ full Plone REST API is so you can create alternative endpoints tailored to specific usecases. A number of these specific endpoints are already in active use.
trans-unit.target: The reason for separating this infrastructure into a separate package from the ‘main’ full Plone REST API is so you can create alternative endpoints tailored to specific usecases. A number of these specific endpoints are already in active use.

trans-unit.source: plone.rest allows you to define CORS policies for services in ZCML. The following example defines a policy for all services.
trans-unit.target: plone.rest allows you to define CORS policies for services in ZCML. The following example defines a policy for all services.

trans-unit.source: plone.rest allows you to register HTTP verbs for Plone content with ZCML.
trans-unit.target: plone.rest allows you to register HTTP verbs for Plone content with ZCML.

trans-unit.source: plone.rest allows you to use HTTP verbs such as GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc. in Plone.
trans-unit.target: plone.rest allows you to use HTTP verbs such as GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc. in Plone.

trans-unit.source: plone.rest is for experienced web developers who want to build their own HTTP/REST endpoints on top of Plone.
trans-unit.target: plone.rest is for experienced web developers who want to build their own HTTP/REST endpoints on top of Plone.

trans-unit.source: plone.rest provides the basic infrastructure that allows us to build RESTful endpoints in Plone.
trans-unit.target: plone.rest provides the basic infrastructure that allows us to build RESTful endpoints in Plone.
